website_summaries.verdict: If you don't mind supplying the wood and building your own sawhorses, this option gives you the opportunity to customize two work surfaces to suit your needs.
pros: Doesn't limit you to a specific size, as this kit includes all you need to customize your own sawhorses
Components are sturdy, and can accommodate 2x4 planks capable of handling up to 2,000 lbs
Pack of 2 sets of brackets and hardware
cons: Doesn't include 2x4s - lumber must be purchased separately
Requires some building, but it's not difficult to do

customer_reviews.title: 2 x 4's won't fit - should have read one star reviews on this product
customer_reviews.text: Posting date 4-18-17. Would give zero stars if I could. As other one star reviews indicate these are apparently not designed to fit most 2 x 4's that you would buy at Ace Hardware or Home Depot. Buy these at your own risk and pray to god you don't spend a weekend planing down the wood to get them to fit. I could immediately tell there was going to be a problem and didn't waste my time. Item returned. UPDATE 4-23-17: Found metal brackets at Lowe's that fit STANDARD 2 x 4 dimension wood. Hope this helps someone in the future.
customer_reviews.author: MDK

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: So these brackets are injection molded plastic, but don't let that deter you. For the money, you end up with very sturdy sawhorses. They are easy to assemble. The bad parts about them is that they injection molding is done pretty medium. You'll have to spend a bit of time with an Xacto knife cleaning up edges and stuff, but assuming you have straight lumber, it appears everything fits well. Also, since they are all assembled and screwed together, they are a bit awkward to store. I used to have metal bracket ones that folded up, but I felt they were a bit weak. So trade in some convenience for more sturdiness.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hanson

customer_reviews.title: My favorite tool!
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome. If you do any carpentry, framing or woodwork this is a must have. Easy to build custom saw horses that can be disassembled and stored without taking up much space. Once assembled these are surprisingly strong. Had no problem stacking and holding hundreds of pounds of lumber and sheet metal over 6 week period. Provided screws are worthless - not exterior grade, would recommend replacing them with a few deck screws, other than that the product is fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: A.Wheatley

customer_reviews.title: Good concept, poor execution.
customer_reviews.text: Standard 2x4s from Home Depot wouldn’t fit. You have to slide the lumber into rectangular cutouts. I get why the would need to be snug but it was impossible to slide any of my 2x4 lumber in. The width of the slots were less than 1/8” too narrow to slide the 2x4 in. I tried everything. These are going back.
customer_reviews.author: KMars

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, convenient
customer_reviews.text: Like a lot of you, I live in a neighborhood where all I have is my garage. These are cool because they allow you to assemble and disassemble your saw horses as needed. I made a simple hanger in the corner of my garage, and that's where the 4 a-frames hang. Totally out of the way and exempt from any criticism. Unlike my 4-wheeler. I have not owned these things very long either, but I have tested them with my youthful girth, and they are at least strong enough to keep me off the ground. Mind Blown.
customer_reviews.author: Bloop McFloop

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy but need to change legs to adjust height
customer_reviews.text: These are sturdy sawhorses. I bought them for delivery in the states and then shipped them to my address overseas.. WE all know that a 2x4 is not 2"x4" in reality Works out that a U.S. 2x4 is 3.9mm x 8.7 mm (divide by 2.54 to get inches) while a "2x4" in Europe is 4.2 mm x 9.6 mm. So I had to rip the wood I had to make the boards fit into the resin brackets. The manufacturer ( or Amazon) should indicate the precise dimensions of the wood required to complete the assembly.
customer_reviews.author: SMB.

customer_reviews.title: Sawhorse Brackets
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality set of brackets to build a pair of sawhorses out of. The brackets fit tightly on a standard 2x4. I only had to remove a little on the edges to make them go in on a couple of the boards and adjusting the board to the correct angle makes them slide in easily. The screws are included to put them together along with the instructions on how to or you can use some of your own screws as I did. The best thing about these brackets is they are very sturdy and you can make the sawhorses as tall or wide as you like.
customer_reviews.author: James Stone Rd

customer_reviews.title: Really like mine
customer_reviews.text: Really like these. Anyone with the most basic grasp of shop tools can cut their 2x4s to set up a pair of durable, heavy duty and stackable sawhorses exactly the correct height for their own application in about 20 minutes. All you need are your 2x4s, a handful of extra screws (I used drywall screws, worked great) and a saw and driver. I used #2 grade lumber. The brackets even include angled feet. Good heavy duty plastic. I have been using mine now for 3 weeks. Excellent product, exactly as was advertised. Excellent quality, shipped in a timely manner and cheaper than I could have picked up locally. It’s why I use Amazon Prime!
customer_reviews.author: R. E. Statham

customer_reviews.title: Years in and still strong
customer_reviews.text: Had two of these things for years. They are strong and do not wobble. Construction is simple. If you need a sawhorse this is the way to go. I would suggest the maker provide a graph to correlate leg length to final sawhorse height. Doing quick Trigonometry is fun, but disrupts construction flow. Note that these Do Not Fold so they might not be best for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Sir Sparky

customer_reviews.title: Tight fit... actually, a bit too tight. Requires trimming 2x4 ends.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2x4's at Lowes to assemble these sawhorses. None of them actually fit into the brackets. I didn't have a table saw, so I was forced to trim the ends with a jigsaw to get it to fit. Some of the fits were still very tight, and the plastic brackets here actually broke while trying to get it assembled.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and universal
customer_reviews.text: I need a bench to work on my snowboard instead of mounting my vises to the kitchen table, so I built just one to the specs I wanted, made a little shelf to hold my tuning stuff works good for what I needed and sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Roor

customer_reviews.title: Very easy assembly
customer_reviews.text: These brackets are nicely designed to allow for any size or height saw horse that you need. Once assemble with 2x4's that you purchase, it is a rock steady set of saw horses. It even comes with plastic feet to level the horses and provide some protection for the floor if you need to use it indoors. There is not a need to make any angled cuts on the 2x4's. The brackets are designed to work with all straight cut wood. You decide the height and length needed and the brackets will accommodate your needs. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sassy

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, solid and well thought out.
customer_reviews.text: The sawhorse packaging and construction are smarter than me... I hate to admit it. Do not special cut angles in the wood. No mitre needed. keep all wood at 90 degree cuts. While the feet are at an angle, the included feet-pads are angled so that the feet are flat on the floor. Just cut the boards to length and you are good. Also, check the instructions for which screws go where. It matters in the end. Love the sawhorse, very sturdy, great price, and better than the other sawhorses I bought at a big box hardware store, and MUCH cheaper, all at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron W. Beeler

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Love this bracket set. Had to sand down my 2x4’s to get them to fit into the slots. Other than that, these are great, never had a set of saw horses that were so sturdy until now. I recommend! Also had to trim the plastic flash from the edges, which is not uncommon For plastics that are molded. Still worth getting!
customer_reviews.author: Tim D. Maloch

customer_reviews.title: VERY NICE!!!
customer_reviews.text: At last!!! Coupled with my own custom-cut 2x4s, I was able to construct the exact type of specialized sawhorses that I needed for my woodcarving...sturdy, strong and if I make a few sets of 2x4s, versatile. Actually going to buy another set of these because I'm too lazy to reassemble them....and best of all, these are NOT $30-$38, like at Lowe's or Home Depot!!
customer_reviews.author: theWolfGuy

customer_reviews.title: Yes,I'd buy it again but..
customer_reviews.text: Love the premise of the straight cut and assembly of this product. The fit and assembly are great, the instructions are easy to read and understand, and the lower level not only adds a storage area but some rigidity. this is where I have to lessen my overall scoring. The rigidity seems a little less that I was expecting. This may be by design in order to facilitate the one shot injection molding operation as the feet (shot at the same time) have a non-slip or more rubbery feature. All in all, I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin P. Valin

customer_reviews.title: I didn't even need the screws
customer_reviews.text: The tolerances were so tight, that when I assembled this with pressure treated rough cut lumber I had to use a mallet to get it on. So tight was the construction that I could have skipped the screws it comes with entirely. Keep an eye on the feet, they're not interchangeable because they slope towards center.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy bracket unless you have a wood planer!!!
customer_reviews.text: They look very sturdy BUT 2 X 4s are 1.56” by 3.56”. I measured the bracket openings; 1.482” x 3.482” (see photos). The photo with UPC code was pounded in with my “fancy” five pound hammer just to get it in 2 1/2 inches! Yes, I know how to “rough” them down, but for the legs alone that is 14 inches each (times 8 legs).
customer_reviews.author: Robert B.

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: These are grrrreat! Very sturdy! I think I will be boring 1-1/4 holes in the legs and stretcher for lightening and located based on engineering so as not to weaken those components appreciably. I painted my wood with semi gloss black. They look beautiful! Also it hides the lousy look of 2by4's!! Why is iPhone rotating my pics without my authorization?
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: not for rookies
customer_reviews.text: the instructions are not worth a darn, the feet tell you right or left leg but the main plastic body doesent tell you which way is inner or outer so left and right legs mean nothing. had to assemble twice to get them right and I am a full time diy 'er so its correct now.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: easy and quick to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I'm going over in my head what I can say of use to the new buyer of these... One issue is getting them to stand without a wobble. The problem is, even if you have made even cuts etc., the floor can be uneven, causing wobble. The cure for this is simplke: get some shims (sold at any hardware store or Amazon) and put a shim under the leg that wobbles. Shove it under like a wedge. Problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: Manthano

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Saw Horse Design
customer_reviews.text: This is a great set of sawhorses. I purchased just one to see whether it suits my needs. I built my own, but I wanted some taller ones to make a table out of them to set a piece of 4 X 8 Plywood on. The saw horses are very rigid and an excellent design. I cut the top 2X4 plate about 4 inches longer at the top so I can mount a small portable vise of clamp something to cut onto the sawhorse. The assembly instructions do not mention this, But it is something to keep in mind from the perspective of versatility.
customer_reviews.author: John Sensenstein

customer_reviews.title: Good with a tweek.
customer_reviews.text: This works well. It is very easy to get the feet and or brackets on backwards but not the end of the world. Use the hardware provided with the exception of the 3" screws. In their place I predrilled for a 3" lag with washers. A bolt and nut and washers could be used if handy. The screws need a larger head so as not to pull through the material. The plastic resin parts are strong due to their form and the resin is soft-ish so as not to be brittle. All in all good, form, function and strength even with some minor additions I would recommend .
customer_reviews.author: Larry Mann

customer_reviews.title: Don't get taken in by the positive reviews -  2x4s won't fit!
customer_reviews.text: Good luck in finding 2 x 4s that actually fit!. My advice is to check out the product before wasting your money and time on buying and cutting the wood as you will see that the holes are so badly formed that a 2 x 4 won't actually fit. Like many other purchasers I now have a set of cut and useless 2 x 4s! I see the product is made in the USA. I thought this sounded promising - but they should be ashamed of their lack of quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. R. J. DAVIES

customer_reviews.title: my husband loves them!
customer_reviews.text: It was really easy to cut some wood to make these. No more trying to cut/work on the floor! We've only been using them for a few weeks now but its been well worth it. I dont know how long they will last but so far so good! I'm thinking of buying another set!
customer_reviews.author: jessica jones

customer_reviews.title: Great product and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I really like these saw horses so far. They're easy to build, I mean REALLY easy to build. There are other options such as the small aluminum brackets but I prefer these as they look a lot nicer, provide a wider surface, and are less likely to be pushed over. They do not stack very well unless you want to remove the middle support, for me that is not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Francis X

customer_reviews.title: They are great.
customer_reviews.text: I keep mine in my building holding up a brake for siding. Make sure you don't go too wide with them. I had to redo, because I went too wide. 36 is 3 foot and that should be wide enough unless you plan on putting something real wide that will stay on them.
customer_reviews.author: Ozzylg

customer_reviews.title: Pure junk
customer_reviews.text: Sorry but this this is a waste of money. Very difficult to get together and once assembled it is too flimsy to do anything with. After the first job I used it on I threw it out. I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: This is junk. Literally the worst thing I've bought in a long time. Just about every piece on it broke during assembly. Save your money and frustration and get something else that works. I feel like billing the company that makes these for making me waste my 2x4's.
customer_reviews.author: R. Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff!!
customer_reviews.text: Have had a set for a few years and my son in laws father has always admired the flexibility of size, so I purchased him a set for helping me with a project. Also have the benches and shop table set.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Coffey

customer_reviews.title: A good idea
customer_reviews.text: I made taller legs to use it as a base for an art table. I receive no instructions. there are two types of screws... I’m not sure why. I used the shorter ones in the feel. The wood screws seemed longer than necessary, and so I had to predrill the holes.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Dittmar

customer_reviews.title: Every cowboy loves a sturdy horse!
customer_reviews.text: These work great and are very sturdy. Made mine 4 feet wide, and can do so much with them. I like that I can easily swap out the top board when it get's cut up and messy. Make sure you have a place to store them, because they don't collapse and don't interlock very tightly because of the lower cross-piece.
customer_reviews.author: Brad R

customer_reviews.title: No headline!
customer_reviews.text: I don't recommend these sawhorse brackets. The brackets I ordered were delivered with no instructions, and if you want a sturdy platform to work on, you'll have to install lengthwise braces close to the bottoms of the legs. I recommend collapsible metal sawhorses.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I had the metal jaw clamp sawhorse brackets that were a pain in the butt. They kept sliding and moving when I did any kind of work. I was looking for a plastic bracket that would solve all those problems, give me a sturdy yet collapsible sawhorse. These are perfect. I didn't even go to the extend of screwing all the 2x4s into place and absolutely zero problems. Just what I was looking for. 4 brackets = 2 sawhorses, perfect! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty, adaptable and fun to put together.
customer_reviews.text: I truly enjoyed opening, building and using these saw horses in no time. They come complete with very good quality hardware used to assemble. When assembled I find them to be sturdy and functional . Just add 2X4s sized to your needs to complete the build. The only improvement would be to have them collapse to take up a smaller footprint when in storage mode. But, that is no major drawback to me.
customer_reviews.author: Leo Leon Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Alternative use and very nice
customer_reviews.text: Used these to create a desk work space, did the job very nicely. It is sturdy and attractive ( i used cedar) and very clever in its construction such that all your cuts are flat and the sloping angles are accomplished through the brackets and the feet. A liitle instruction sheet or photo sheet would have been helpful but it was not hard to figure out. Took about one hour to cut and assemble including the desktop. Ended up with a large, great looking workspace for less than a $100 bucks (again cedar used throughout so much more pricey especially on the desk top materials). Ikea cannot touch that for a lesser product.
customer_reviews.author: Fair and Balanced

customer_reviews.title: and great for making your pair at exactly the height and ...
customer_reviews.text: As strong and solid as any sawhorse set I have ever used, and great for making your pair at exactly the height and width you want. I wanted mine at waist height so I would not have to lean over when cutting and routing timbers. I'd suggest you paint your 2x4 lumber before assembly if you are going to leave your set out and exposed to the weather, Easy quick assembly.
customer_reviews.author: Capt Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Clever Idea
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together. No longer need to use the circular saw with the board on my lap. Many savings on pants and stitches!
customer_reviews.author: dunga

customer_reviews.title: perfect sawhorses
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, I made them so I can remove the center boards for easy storage and transport. Takes about 5 minutes to reinstall center boards. I used 4x4 for the top, so I could set a ladder frame in them for working with plywood sheets. Best thing I have used for with wood or project table.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel F.

customer_reviews.title: It is not even close to heavy duty, it is wiggling under load
customer_reviews.text: if you want to make reliable do not use this craft,
customer_reviews.author: Igor Vasilchikov

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: As i shopped around for saw horses prices where good but the saw horses were poorly assembled and sizes were either to low or to hi for my height,price was excellent for this quality pro product. ASSEMBLY WAS A BREEZE EXCELLENT INSTRUCTIONS & ALL NECESSARY PARTS WERE INCLUDED.chose your own lumber ,make the size that fits your height i`am 6 ft standing straight up with palms flat on surface about 36 inches for me worked great , cut square and don`t forget the 1 inch over hang on the top support 2x4.
customer_reviews.author: CHUCKIETWO

customer_reviews.title: It's a start
customer_reviews.text: I have to rubber hammer carefully each and every piece of this thing. Even sanded the wood just to make slide. Disassembled after one use and thrown away for good.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander G

customer_reviews.title: This is well engineered product. The manual is visual ...
customer_reviews.text: This is well engineered product. The manual is visual only, but who needs text? I would only propose to add there closeup regarding the orientation of the foot pads. I did not have any problem but could imagine that some people could install legs or the sides backwards. But giving 5 stars because being retired mechanical engineer, I really appreciated how thoughtfully and with attention to detail was this design done.
customer_reviews.author: Stary Kozel

customer_reviews.title: I really like these brackets
customer_reviews.text: I really like these brackets. FYI- the slots that the 2x4s slide into are really tight. Be prepared to use a hammer (or a 3lb maul, which is what I ended up using). Once assembled, the set is quite sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Gern B.

customer_reviews.title: Only comes with brackets
customer_reviews.text: I had no idea that I would have to buy and cut a 2x4x8 but other than that it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Leopold the Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Buy the right wood and they go together great - super strong.
customer_reviews.text: Had em put together in about five minutes. Super strong. I got no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Omfgzombies!

customer_reviews.title: Perfect well designed
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant because of some reviews. But I am very pleased. 2x4s slid in with an issue. The plastic feet are perfectly shaped to keep them level. And of course you can make comfortably higher
customer_reviews.author: Frank A.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: This product allowed me to easily build a pair of saw horses without the hassle of figuring out angles and such. Cut the 2x4 s to length, slide them into the molded sawhorse brackets and screw them in with the supplied hardware. Easy peasey! Strong ! Looking forward to trying their other products
customer_reviews.author: James Hawlk

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Assemble
customer_reviews.text: These made very nice saw horses. Easy to assemble and everything included. Once made they are very sturdy, one horse stores on top of another.
customer_reviews.author: DAH

customer_reviews.title: was under the impression you get what you see!
customer_reviews.text: Does not come with the wood legs. Had to buy at local home depot separately. Made this more expensive than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa  Kers

customer_reviews.title: Assembly instructions have an error, but seems to work fine
customer_reviews.text: Took a bit of assembly but it seems to work well. The instructions were incorrect, having the feet being screwed on backwards (L/R). It's obvious when you start standing up the legs that they should be reversed but it's something that could and should easily be corrected on the included instruction sheet.
customer_reviews.author: Greg  Matthews

customer_reviews.title: Easy way to make sawhorses.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived 1 day Early. Simple simple simple to make. I wanted them wider and higher than regular sawhorses.
customer_reviews.author: murphy l.

customer_reviews.title: Awesomeness
customer_reviews.text: Love these I repurposed an old metal shed for my hubby 2 do wood work in..Went 2 lowes bought the wood I needed and had then cut it 2 the size I wanted and voila..awesomeness.. Oh yea and the "directions" are awesome gives u the exact measurements of wood and how many of each that you would need..My hubby was impressed because I put them 2gether myself :)
customer_reviews.author: Julie Be'z

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: You can make them any size which is biggest benefit. They are not super-super stable, but are pretty good. They tend to rack a little if you put force from the side, but the adjustability makes up for it. If you put them together very well, it takes out some of the wobbly. Some how I ordered more than I needed. I think the quantity is confusing if I remember correctly.
customer_reviews.author: David in CA

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, and assemble. I went to Lowes, and they pre-cut all of the 2*4's for me. I added a board and created a long desk for my boys room. Easy to do, and looks like a store bought desk. I will upload pictures later.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Way superior to metal ones.
customer_reviews.text: If looks don't matter, these are the way to go. They create rock steady bases for tabletops, project benches, you name it. Much better, imo, than the metal brackets, stronger, sturdier, but they don't fold up.
customer_reviews.author: Bob H

customer_reviews.title: Make sure that you use wood without a twist
customer_reviews.text: Two things that I like: 1) The flat top that is wide for great stability 2) The cross bar underneath that is working great for storing wood on. And if you have a twist in some of the 2x4's then that extra weight really takes the wobble off. I might get another one.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Pokerwinski

customer_reviews.title: you get awesome sawhorses at a very inexpensive price point
customer_reviews.text: If you assemble these somewhat carefully, you get awesome sawhorses at a very inexpensive price point. If you don't assemble them somewhat carefully, my guess is you get some fairly mediocre sawhorses that you wish you hadn't spent the time or money on. You'll get out what you put in. If you're not a little handy with a circular saw and an impact driver / drill / screwdriver, I'd steer clear. If you are, have at it, brother (or sister)!
customer_reviews.author: Sean Steele

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Made horses for grandkids, stung and durable, grandpa wants them back when the girls out grow them!
customer_reviews.author: May

customer_reviews.title: Standing room only!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a quick table for artmaking. The top I had was large, but I wanted the ability to move, enlarge or make smaller. Building these was a cinch. I had the lumber yard pre-cut the 2x4's and had them together and under my table within 45 minutes. Tip: sand the edges just a tad to get any splinters away. They slide into the casing very nicely.(Oh, I had to stand on my table and it was no problem-150 lbs!)
customer_reviews.author: Issima

customer_reviews.title: Pick your Ideal Height and Width.  Stronger than you'd expect
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical at first due to the price but after buying I can say it was easily worth the investment. Having the ability to size these to any height was great. I chose to have them higher than average to allow me to use a table base and to catch lumber from the table saw. One tip: don't over-tighten the screws as they could possibly pull through. The saw horses are the most sturdy I've ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Rico

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy way to build a couple sawhorses
customer_reviews.text: Makes building a pair of sturdy sawhorses super simple. Cut 2x4s to the sizes you want, slide them in the brackets, screw in place, add the pre-leveled feet, and that's it. No worrying about cutting the bottom of the legs to the correct angle so the sawhorse sits level -- the included feet take care of that for you. I assembled both in less than 30 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: pamela

customer_reviews.title: Great item and going to get one more set
customer_reviews.text: Great saw horses just had t add the 2x4 at the length I wanted and they handle the load with no problems
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Great for making customized saw horses.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and build your own saw horses. I purchased these so I could make my saw horses to the height I wanted, not the height others dictated to me. They do the job well and I'm happy with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan Windon

customer_reviews.title: Really Easy Sawhorses :-)
customer_reviews.text: I really like these kits, they make pretty sturdy set of saw horse. I didn't like putting them together. One tool that is really helpful is a rubber mallet, there tight. Especially when useing pressure treated 2x4's. I also on the second one made some small angle cuts on the 2" sides of the lumber and they did slip together a lot better.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Davidson

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product
customer_reviews.text: I always have various projects going on around my house and now I can finally get off the ground with my miter saw and table saw. Being able to quickly change the height and width of these sawhorses is an attractive feature, but I don't think its something I'll need very often. Even with purchasing the 2x4's, you'll still be way under the cost of another set of sawhorses. The two boards between the legs can pop out and they stack to store fairly well. I like these sawhorses, this company makes a work bench kit that I am looking forward to picking up in the spring.
customer_reviews.author: Gormley

customer_reviews.title: very well made and practical I will use these as ...
customer_reviews.text: very well made and practical I will use these as supports for when I build a raised garden beds at disabled veterans homes
customer_reviews.author: L. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, but delivery was missing hardware
customer_reviews.text: These are very sturdy and relatively easy to assemble, but my delivery was missing hardware. We bought 2 sets (enough to make 4 horses), but only received enough screws for 3 horses.
customer_reviews.author: Ollie

customer_reviews.title: Snug Fit
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Other reviews noted that the brackets didn't accommodate the 2x4s that they were using. I found that 2x4s which had been sufficiently dried slid into the brackets with ease. The 2x4s that had been sitting out in the lumber yard, sucking in moisture, were almost impossible to fit into these forms. In all, great product for the price if you use dried lumber. Maybe the manufacturer should make a note of this in their assembly instructions?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: best set I ever put together I used silicone spray ...
customer_reviews.text: best set I ever put together I used silicone spray to slide the wood into the frames works really well and I put a 2x8 on top to protect the top of frame also they come with the screws too.
customer_reviews.author: James N H

customer_reviews.title: I give it 2 stars because it is nice to be able to get lumber cut to whatever ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't care how much $ you make per hour -- your time and emotional sanity are worth more than what this costs. I somehow forgot that these brackets are full on hell to put together. The holes where you slide the 2x4s into are the EXACT size of the 2x4, making it almost impossible to push the wood through the holes. It also requires a full body workout because of necessary repeated slamming of the wood into the floor for leverage over and over again. For the cost, it's too close to just buying an adjustable sawhorse. I give it 2 stars because it's nice to be able to get lumber cut to whatever size you want.
customer_reviews.author: Marina

customer_reviews.title: I like the product
customer_reviews.text: I like the product, but Amazon has need for improvement here I ordered the product twice, first time I just got 2 brackets, no screws and no instructions. So I ordered again thinking the product description was for the number of brackets and then I got 4 brackets screws and instructions, bad show Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen E.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product from a Kansas local company
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy & still lightweight. Didn’t realize until reading the instruction sheet that they are manufactured just 45 miles away in Emporia KS. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 2 issues: Mine only had half the hardware, it was too tight to fit pressure treated 2x4s.
customer_reviews.text: 2 issues: Mine only had half the hardware, it was too tight to fit pressure treated 2x4s. Obviously, it wasn't a big deal to find screws, I had stainless steel deck screws in both lengths. The other issue was more of a pain: I had to plane down all the 2x4s for them to fit, I guess pressure treated lumber is swelled up some.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A. Oehser

customer_reviews.title: Excellent item, although the instructions (if you read them) ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent item, although the instructions (if you read them) are somewhat confusing...instead use your own common sense. Anyway, as I said, this is an excellent item. I have used them practically every day since I put them together for various purposes other than sawing. They are very, very sturdy and stable. Well, that is, if you measure and cut the 2x4's evenly.
customer_reviews.author: Roy K.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to build. Put the feet on last. My second set because I really liked the first set, use the heck out of them during my shop build, now that I'm hanging sheetrock My first set is in use and the rest of horse brackets are a joke, these are sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Retired Computer Tech

customer_reviews.title: Get the two pack.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to build and easy to modify. Very sturdy for the the money.
customer_reviews.author: BRENT G. EILERT

customer_reviews.title: ROCK SOLID @ PERFECT HEIGHT
customer_reviews.text: Very fast delivery. Cut each leg to the height you want as a finished deck and it finishes that way. Very stable when assembled. 100% satisfaction. Clearly worth the extra cost and a couple of minutes assembly.
customer_reviews.author: Drayton Colley

customer_reviews.title: It worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I used one set for a massive piñata stand, and it actually worked. I used 10 foot 2x4s for the legs and 2-8 foot 2x4s for the cross brace (also added another short 2x4 about halfway down the legs for extra support). It worked like a charm. Wouldn't see why these wouldn't work great as their intended purpose.
customer_reviews.author: VM

customer_reviews.title: Don't use pressure treated wood.
customer_reviews.text: They're good, light-duty sawhorses. My advice, though, is that you don't get too clever and try to use pressure-treated wood to build your sawhorses. The wood will be just slightly too large to fit in the sockets. Also, make sure you have a rubber mallet, because it was a little difficult to get the boards to slide into the sockets. That said, it was pretty user-friendly for a novice like me. I was able to put them together pretty quickly and with no injury to myself. They're stable and will serve for my stupid around-the-house projects, but I wouldn't want to rely on them if I were a real handyman or contractor.
customer_reviews.author: Joey Joe Joe Jr. Shabadoo

customer_reviews.title: Beginner's guide.
customer_reviews.text: It's plastic, it's not too expensive, not too cheap, for what it's worth, it's basically a first timer's dream, slide in some half decent lumber cut to length, screw it in, put it all up, done in an hour, you're on your way to putting together a proper set of sawhorses, and whatever projects you need a level surface for, it's not pretty, or even reusable as it should be, it just gets you started.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Elias

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Great concept, horrible execution. Does not accommodate 2x4s, not the size they sell at Home Depot. (1 1/2 x 3 1/2). Had to modify product extensibly. Not very stable either.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan S.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THESE.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY TREATED LUMBER !!! IT IS LARGER AND WILL NOT SLIDE IN BRACKETS. MUST USE REGULAR 2X4 WOOD.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Plastic crap
customer_reviews.text: Total garbage, don't waste your money. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Get them, they work great. Super easy to make, would've been easier if I had already had some saw horses.
customer_reviews.author: Dante Fiero

customer_reviews.title: Great product, doesn’t come with wood
customer_reviews.text: Great product - doesn’t come with the wooden pieces though
customer_reviews.author: GH

customer_reviews.title: Works great, DO NOT use pressure treated wood
customer_reviews.text: These work great and are very sturdy. Just remember not to try to use pressure treated wood with them as pressure treated wood is wet and swollen. It won't fit into the slots. Just stick to standard white kiln dried 2x4's and you'll be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Homer

customer_reviews.title: Everybody needs a saw horse.
customer_reviews.text: Second time around for this product and me. Love this gear!
customer_reviews.author: James A. Yochum

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the money
customer_reviews.text: I plan on putting these to use this spring and summer.
customer_reviews.author: Ms B

customer_reviews.title: They work pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Wood fit in the slots. With enough wood in the slots, I got a thing to cut more wood on. It should be easier to cut wood to fit into slots and then I can have more wood cutting wood.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: 2x4’s do not fit
customer_reviews.text: Poorly designed- standard 2x4 do not fit - the dimensions are ridiculously too tight. Tapping with a hammer to force them in causes the bracket to crack. Cannot recommend.
customer_reviews.author: things

customer_reviews.title: Didn't want to fit with straight boards?
customer_reviews.text: these bracket was hard to get to fit had difficulty making 2x4s fit and boards were strso
customer_reviews.author: Michael N. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: These things are AWESOME! I used them to make trestles for new ...
customer_reviews.text: These things are AWESOME! I used them to make trestles for new standing-height desk, and all my co-workers want to know where I got my "desk kit." The feet make it possible to have stable trestles without making a single angled cut.
customer_reviews.author: SLG521

customer_reviews.title: If you follow directions this thing is perfect! Has all the hardware needed
customer_reviews.text: Read the directions ! Make sure you have the 1” over hang on the horizontal boards!!!! If you follow directions this thing is perfect ! Has all the hardware needed. Sand your wood before you put it in!
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie Verma

customer_reviews.title: These brackets make a great, very stable sawhorse
customer_reviews.text: These brackets make a great, very stable sawhorse. Rock solid. One minor problem is that I had to trim away some plastic at the edges in order to get the boards through. No big deal though.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Jewell

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Priced well
customer_reviews.text: these are great. Quickly cut some scrap 2 x to fit and built these up. Nice because you can disassemble if you aren't going to use them for a while. They are sturdier and more durable that the totally plastic ones.
customer_reviews.author: Janene

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this and would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I liked the fact I can make sawhorses any size I want. I built mine at 4' high by 5' long for accommodate at GTO frame that I'm restoring.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Works great, good value
customer_reviews.text: They came with these angled feet that makes them sit solid on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quick, easy, and very useful
customer_reviews.text: This is such an upgrade from the old metal single piece sawhorse frames. These were easy to put together and are incredibly sturdy. I had to use a hammer to get a couple of legs all the way in. But with cutting and assembly, it only took about 30 minutes to complete. Simple but effective. Great set of sawhorses.
customer_reviews.author: J. Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Great solution if you need a custom size sawhorse
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6'6" tall so a regular sawhorse is way to low for me to use without hurting my back. I was able to build a sawhorse the height I needed for working comfortably. I used them for cutting and painting trim so far. Great product, but a bit expensive. I they were a little lower in price I would buy another set.
customer_reviews.author: Donk

product_meta.title: 2x4basics 90196 Custom Pro Brackets Sawhorse - 2 Pack
product_meta.description: Size Name:2-packThe Hopkins 90196 Pro Brackets are the ideal tool for those DIY projects. Make it any size by adding 2x4's (lumber not included) to make a strong, stable, and customized sawhorse. Build up to 8 feet long and 4 feet high and a support weight of up to 2000 pounds making it so you're no longer limited to a standard size sawhorse. Easily assembles with only a screwdriver and includes all hardware, (4 brackets, and 8 stabilizing feet to make 2 sawhorses).
feature_bullets: Lumber not included with each kit
Brackets made of heavy gauge structural resin
Can support up to 2000 lbs (900 kg) per pair
Easily assembles with only a screwdriver
Includes all hardware - 4 brackets, and 8 stabilizing feet to make 2 sawhorses
